intro: Geigeria obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate geigeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Geigeria obovata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
